headline: The Psalm of 17 Days
description: A transitional psalm marking Aleksandr’s movement from the old self into the chosen future, written during the Ash Moon Ascending phase.
author: Aleksandr Agnitio
resonantThread: Becoming, Transformation, Threshold Crossing, Identity Renewal
whyItMatters: This psalm marks the moment Aleksandr stopped fleeing the old self and began walking deliberately toward the life he has chosen with God. It is a threshold poem and an early declaration of spiritual adulthood.

motifMap.meaning: Rising from the remnants of the old self; the heat of transformation.
The ash of what has been burned away; the remnants of previous identities.
The upward motion into the new land, chosen freely and consciously.

articleExcerpt: 17 days. A lifetime of preparation before the first real change. I have run many times before, fleeing the old self. THIS TIME I step. I choose. A new self in a new place, with discernment, with Grace, with God.
sourceFragments: I have run many times before
THIS TIME I step. I choose.
A new self in a new place
